text: The Iran national women's cricket team is the team that represents the country of Iran in international women's cricket matches. They made their international debut when they played at the 2009 ACC Women's Twenty20 Championship, losing to Nepal in July 2009,https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Scorecards/247/247470.html since then took part in the 2013 ACC Women's Championship,http://www.asiancricket.org/index.php/tournaments/acc-womens- championship-2013/2579 and then the 2014 ACC Women's Premier.http://www.asiancricket.org/index.php/tournaments/acc-womens- premier-2014/2831 In April 2018, the International Cricket Council (ICC) granted full Women's Twenty20 International (WT20I) status to all its members. Therefore, all Twenty20 matches played between Iran women and another international side after 1 July 2018 will be a full WT20I. ==Tournament history== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Host/Year !Round/Rank |- | 2009 ACC Women's Twenty20 Championship ||8th place |- | 2013 ACC Women's Championship||6th place |- | 2014 ACC Women's Premier||6th place |} ==Head coaches== * Shamsa Hashmi 2008-2009 * Hajira Sarwar 2010-2013 * Mozhdeh Bavandpour 2014 ==Captains== *Nahid Hakimian 2009 *Somayyeh Sahrapour 2013 *Nasimeh Rahshetaei 2014 ==Awards== *2012 Monir Habibi, Volunteer of the Year, Pepsi ICC Development Programme Awards *2013 Winners, Spirit of Cricket Award ACC Women’s Championshiphttp://www.asiancricket.org/index.php/members/iran ==Limited-overs head-to-head== Updated until last match played: 17 February 2014 *The result percentage excludes no results and counts ties as half a win {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width: 500px;" |- | colspan=7 align="center" | vs ICC Associate members |- !
